result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald R Kutzleb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald R Kutzleb

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Court: Released on a $200 payment and then 25.00/month starting Oct 15, 2016 until paid in full
Financial Statment for Failure to Pay

Case called @ 3:57 p.m. Defendant Ronald R Kutzleb in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court orders: Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP and DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.
& Affidavit to Exempt Vehicles - Unable to process request as the OWI conviction was from another county

11:05 am case called. Defendant Ronald R Kutzleb in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by ADA Anderson makes a statement regarding IID. May need one additional date for resolution. Statement by defendant-requests additional 45 days to conclude.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Ronald R Kutzleb in court, appearing in person.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per ADA:  Driver Safety Plan undertaken with AODA - proof provided for ADA's review.   8 week program on AODA.  State willing to allow for more time to obtain a valid DL with the proactive steps being undertaken.  P/S Scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 11:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Ronald R Kutzleb in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by ADA Anderson regarding status of case. Defendant states he is working on getting his license back.  Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 09:10 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Ronald R Kutzleb in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by ADA Anderson-defendant stated he would like to get his license. Statement by defendant-has not obtained his license yet and makes statement regarding issues in becoming valid. Statement by Court to defendant.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Case Recalled @ 3:37 PM:  Per Mr. Kutzleb, he met with SPD and did not qualify for their services.  Def requests to speak with the State without counsel.  ADA will speak with Defendant personally today on resolution.
No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.

Case Called @ 3:13 PM: Defendant Ronald R Kutzleb in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - has no funds to retain own counsel.  Based upon financial discussions, Def referred to SPD for eligibility.  NGP entered by Court.   Def to meet with SPD on eligibility before leaving today.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 09:35 am.
